title: PD probably needs to be reworked or removed
body:
[](http://puu.sh/qUtmj/fccfa49595.jpg)

Automatically winning duels against anyone on relatively equal ground because of a 12% damage reduction shouldn't be a thing
All the other zeal items have some cool unique effect with a specialized purpose.
PD is just "I bought it so I now autowin duels that were otherwise reasonably close"

Not to mention that the damage reduction lasts for a whopping 10 seconds
At the very least it should be changed to scale with level so that someone like {{champion:157}} who rushes it as a first item half the time doesn't walk into lane with it at level 11 and effectively keep a 12% damage reduction on you until your next back.
Maybe something like 5-10 seconds from levels 1-18 would work better if Riot is intent on keeping this iteration of it in the game

No.
No champion will ever be deleted.
One word: Karma.

Karma has retained her entire kit from her previous iteration.
Ult that boosts all other abilities, Link, Shield and nuke Q. Some mechanics were gone obviously but that doesn't correspond to a deleted champion. She still plays in her intended roles (mage/supp) as she did previously.

If that's how you define "_retained the entire kit_" then I can find multiple champions who have exactly same kits.

All of her abilities, Mantra included, are completely different in their execution, her lore is completely different and her look is completely different.

The only common points she has with the old Karma is her name, Mantra's name and the fact she's an Ionian Elder.

it's more the stats that are a problem lmfao

{{item:3046}}  costs less than firecanon and gives 15% more AS, a good dueling passive and tons of ms in fight.
dueling won't make you win the game, but winning a fight due to the stats will.

RFC also gives the least AS out of all the zeal items, a better comparison would probably be between Shiv and PD, where there is a 10% AS difference.

>Automatically winning duels against anyone on relatively equal ground because of a 12% damage reduction shouldn't be a thing

Why not?  The other items have unique utility to bring to teamfights and skirmishes.  This one is for dueling (and actually a pretty sweet defensive item against burst)

This is the basic model. Each AS/Crit item brovides the basic stats that ADCs need and something unique. 

PD - Dueling power
RFC - Range/Poke
Shiv - Burst/AOE clear
Hurricane - Sustained AOE autos

If the stats or bonuses aren't properly tuned though, one or more of these can become dominant. I think the balance and systems teams are always evaluating and looking at usage stats, pro usage, etc to keep them balanced. 

(personally I have no info on if PD is getting adjusted, I'll check)

This isn't a totally unreasonable point. We designed the crit/as items to create compelling choices for Marksmen specifically. 

So, in some fighter cases there is a 'solved' item (often pd) but it's no worse now than it was before when it was always shiv. It means we have future work to do still.
I feel for marksmen it is fairly reasonable and it might just be cases where Yasuo builds it first is more of a Champion kit problem than an item problem.

Thank you for posting this so players will actually believe me in game when I tell them what the crit items are made for now.

Seriously, why is it that the instant an item is finally being used everyone just goes "OP! REWORK OR NERF!"? it's getting tiring and boring. {{item:3046}} is in a nice spot and it fills it's niche rather nicely. If the other {{item:3086}} items aren't up to par with it then it's because they have been nerfed MULTIPLE times and is a sign that maybe they are the ones who should be looked at and not an item that no one cared at all up until recently.

True, but you don't see tanks buying these items,  because even at 12%, that's low. I mean, even GA, assuming you already have 200 Armor/MR, gives a 17% damage reduction, and that's against *all enemies*. An early game squishy at 50 Armor / 50 MR that gets a {{item:1029}} {{item:1033}} on top will get 10% physical damage reduction and 16.6% magic damage reduction to all enemies for 750g. We're talking about this much effectiveness on a single-target basis being OP?

Because he doesn't care about crit or AS

Honestly i don't agree with offensive items getting all these defensive passives. An assassin or burst mage should be able to kill the adc and rather quickly offensive items should be just that offensive. {{item:3046}} already gives better raw stats compared to the other zeal items and all zeal items give movement speed to help kite it really does not need a built in defensive mechanic. if you defensive stats you should have to build defensive items the same rule should apply to {{item:3156}} and {{item:3812}} dont even get me started on when a certain someone builds all 3 of them {{champion:104}}

Yasuo and Graves are probably the only ones "abusing" it even if you could call it that. 

I think the item is in a perfectly good spot since it fills a niche (anti burst and better dueling potential) in sacrifice of utility from RFC or the raw AoE from Shiv.

I just think this is something the Boards are claiming OP just so they can form a new circlejerk now that Yas is getting nerfed.
It's something that looks OP on paper but isn't really OP in-game. So people that don't use the item complain about it because they honestly just don't know, probably.

People weren't buying PD when they introduced RFC, and even before then when Shiv was cooler to have. Riot wanted to give a legitimate reason for ADs to prioritize it over the other zeal items. Just so happens that Yasuo is strong as sht with it.
It gives too much for its cost, plain and simple. Reduce the attack speed and bump the cost up by 50g or something.

Here's the thing:

{{item:3085}} : Mainly for team fighting with consistent dps on multiple enemy champs

{{item:3087}} : Mainly for wave clearing with bonus damage against minions

{{item:3094}} : Mainly for sieging with its application against turrets and bonus range when charged

{{item:3046}} : Mainly for 1v1 dueling since it decreases the damage from the guy that you last hit

Each Zeal item has its niche carved out pretty well for a variety of different possible uses. I wouldn't screw over PD for being the duelist one because some marksmen might want to duel. It's not like the rift is filled with duels all over the joint anyway.
